turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Did you send my folks in Philly the check...?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I put a lotta trust in you, Chickie...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I know you do, Sidney.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't judge a situation where you don't know what's involved...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I swear, Sidney, I can't help it - sometimes I wonder what I see in you...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: That's no way to talk...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Or what you see in me, for that matter...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Stay down town tonight.  Maybe we'll take in a show, etc.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: If you want me to -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Where's those glossy prints you promised?  Tonight's the latest I can place them -

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Well, thanks, anyway - let's forget it.  It's cold out here, Susie.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I'm feeling too good to fight with you, but that isn't what I said - I said you snoop.  For instance, what were you doing around my hotel the other night?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Begging your pardon, I haven't been down the bowery in years!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's a habit with me.  So now I'm briefed.  So what?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Frank thinks I shouldn't have come here -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why me...?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Why not you?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: That's your idea of logic?  I tell the Judge I didn't murder the man - the Judge says, "Why not you?"

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Only two men in this town could be responsible for that smear - you or Hunsecker or both.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Dallas, ask your own manager - he's standing here like a pained wolfhound - Hunsecker and Elwell are enemies to the knife.  So how do you get him doing J.J. a favor?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: It is a favor, isn't it?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: According to you, yeah.  Dallas, your mouth is as big as a basket and twice as empty!  I don't like you, comma, but neither do I go along with this column saying you smoke marijuana and belong with the Reds.  Also, since we're talking repulsive, J.J. won't like this for two cents!  Don't give me that look, Dallas - J.J. believes in fair play.  And secondly, this could splatter his sister with rotten egg by implication - your her boyfriend!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You're talking very fast.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Well, I'll tell you what - excuse me for breathing, will ya?  How do you like it?  He comes to my office and -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Frank, you don't listen!  J.J. just told you to shut your mouth!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Don't you think it's about time you shut yours?  Who are you to tell a man like Frank D'Angelo to shut up?!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Give him credit---the boy's gall is gorgeous!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Why don't we hear what Susie has to say?

turns.speaker: TEMPLE
turns.text: You watch him, Al, I s...s...stutter!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Temple, I caught your act the other night and -

turns.speaker: TEMPLE
turns.text: Did you now?  On which bounce?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: - and I just had to drop by and tell you how great I thought you were.

turns.speaker: TEMPLE
turns.text: Cheers.  What time is it, Al?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No, I don't mind.  I'm busy too.

turns.speaker: TEMPLE
turns.text: Good!  We're all off to Utica, so excuse me, Mr. Frannis-on-the- Portisan.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If there's a funnier man in the world than Herbie Temple at the Palace...uh...pardon us for not catching the name, we were too busy laughing.  No, make that 'screaming'.  It's sweet of you, J.J., thanks. Probably see you at Twenty One tonight.  No, for supper, late. Right. 'Bye...

turns.speaker: TEMPLE
turns.text: Speak to this lad, Al, ... to Mr. Falco.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: See me in my office.

turns.speaker: TEMPLE
turns.text: And it would cost a pretty penny, huh?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: You tell him, I stutter!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You're touchy, Sidney - don't be so touchy...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I wasn't looking for a brawl.  I came to bring him a present.  Wanna bite to eat?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Feels like a Monday night, don't it...?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Not to me.  Sometimes, the world feels like a cage.  Then someone comes along and opens the door...and it's never Monday night again...  I wish you and Steve could like each other.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: We stick in each others craw.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Yes, but why?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Well, for one thing, he thinks J.J. is some kind of monster.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Where do you come off to make a remark like that?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Who could love a man who keeps jumping through burning hoops, like a trained poodle?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Do you think J.J. likes Steve...?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Frankly, yes, to my surprise.  He thinks he's very gifted - those boys'll go a big mile, he thinks.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: It's given me a big lift to know that some people want me for myself, not just because I'm my brother's sister.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Chickie, I'll have to laugh at that - an attractive girl like you...!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I hope that J.J. really likes Steve, that it isn't an act.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Why should he put on an act?  Your brother has told PRESIDENTS where to go and what to do!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: It's not my nature, Susie, but I'll talk to you like an uncle...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: But I don't need an uncle, Sidney.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen, get a good night's sleep - tomorrow's another day.  Feeling sorry for yourself won't help.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I'm sorry about Steve, not myself. I'm even sorry for my brother.  To be so lonely, without one real friend in the world - to have to hang on to a worthless rag of a girl like me because she's his only real family -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Come on now, chickie, why don't you go to bed...?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: And I'm sorry for you, too, Sidney. You're going down with the ship.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: What ship?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Susie, whatever problems you have with J.J. - I didn't invent them! What're you blaming me for?  If you learned to let out your hatred you would be better off!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Like you?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Yeah!  Like me!  I don't choke on my own gall - I fight back!  Let THEM choke, not me!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I'm not a man, Sidney, I'm -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I know that bit - you're a girl; you need a man to give you strength! So what do you pick such weak sisters for?  Don't you know yet that you fight fire with fire, not with tear drops?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I could almost forgive you if what you did to Steve came from jealousy and love...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I didn't do anything!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: ...but you did it for greed, Sidney - and that's pathetic.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Don't run away - I was always the man for you!  I'm talking to you out of two years of silence - listen to what I say!  Inside of six months -

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Please, Sidney, I can't stand this -

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: J.J., if you think -

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Don't explain, Sidney... It doesn't matter now...

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Jimmy!  This is a coincidence.  I am just going -

turns.speaker: WELDON
turns.text: Yeah.  A coincidence you should run into the very man you've been ducking all week!  This is my press agent, Joan.

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: I tried to reach you twice -

turns.speaker: WELDON
turns.text: What do you do for that hundred a week.  Fall out of bed?

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Jimmy, I'm on my way inside right now to talk to Hunsecker.  I can promise you -

turns.speaker: WELDON
turns.text: Joan, call a cop!  We'll arrest this kid for larceny!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: Listen, when your band was playing at Roseland -

turns.speaker: WELDON
turns.text: That was two months ago.  Take your hand out of my pocket, thief!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: No more you don't!  What is this - You're showing off for her?  They're supposed to hear you in Korea?

turns.speaker: WELDON
turns.text: He's intuitive - he knows he's getting fired!

turns.speaker: SIDNEY
turns.text: If you're funny, James, I'm a pretzel!  Drop dead!

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: This is big, you know.  Very big! Let's go out later, drink some firewater.  With the boys.  Fred can call Millie and -

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Steve, I'd rather you didn't say anything for a day or two...until I tell my brother...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: You haven't told him yet...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I'm telling him in the morning after breakfast.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Steve, my brother isn't as bad as he's painted.  He isn't perfect, but -

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: But he isn't going to like this, Susie.  And he makes you nervous, not me.  No, I take that back - he makes me nervous, too.  But I wouldn't give him a second thought if not for you.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: His stooge, Falco, is around - I saw him walk in.  He's been spying on me for weeks, Susie.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Darling, I don't care - really I don't.  Sidney'd had a secret crush on me for years, but nothing we do is his business -

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: But he could be reporting back to your brother, couldn't he?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Steve, dear, please forget all of this.  What can it matter after tomorrow?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I have a message for you; I love you.  May I dedicate the next number to you?...And the next, and the next. Every Sunday I'll buy you a new bonnet -

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: If the stores are open -

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: And on Monday, I'll take it off and stroke your light brown hair and -

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: And on Tuesday - Hasenpfeffer. STEVE  How do you think I realized I love you?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I made you write a beautiful song...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: No, you had me eating that Chinese food!...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I get the feeling, Falco, that you're always snooping around...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Steve, stop it please...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Hello, Steve.  I'm glad you could come.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Why did you call me?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Would you buy me a cup of coffee? In there...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Steve...what you tried to do today...you tried to take me up on a high mountain...I couldn't go all the way...I failed you...  Will you forgive me?  Have I lost you, Steve?  Have I...?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Well, maybe I was wrong, too... But there's no doubt, Susie, that we have to face some serious things...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: No one's ever stood up to my brother the way you did.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: But you didn't do much about it, Susie.  You walked out, and there I was...solo...and not too good at that.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: I just didn't think that I could antagonize him, Steve -- for OUR sake, I mean.

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Susie, I was there for OUR sake, too.  But what a world it would be if we were all afraid to learn to walk and talk because it might offend poppa!  By the way, I think your brother was completely responsible for the smears...

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Steve, I...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: But I don't care about that now. He knew what he was doing today. He was laying down the conditions under which he MIGHT consent to our marriage - if I would bend to every whim of his, like Sidney!  I couldn't do that, Susie...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: No!  I'm saying that for your sake you have to make a clean break with your brother!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: But, please, Steve, please - one step at a time!  I was born only yesterday!...

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: I told your brother I couldn't be his accomplice.  I can't be yours either, Susie, and encourage him to go on pulverizing you.  I know what type - he's my old man all over again!

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Steve, I feel exhausted...what do you want me to do?

turns.speaker: STEVE
turns.text: Not what you're doing now.  At least don't ask me - don't ask him. You're fighting for your life! What do YOU want to do?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You are saying goodbye, aren't you...?

turns.speaker: TARISSA
turns.text: You going to work all day?

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: I'm sorry, baby.  This thing is just kicking my ass.  I thought we had it with this one...

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: ... but the output went to shit after three seconds.  I'm thinking now it's the way I'm matrixing the command hierarchies...

turns.speaker: TARISSA
turns.text: You need a break.  You'll see it clear when you come back.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: I can't

turns.speaker: TARISSA
turns.text: Miles, it's Sunday.  You promised to take the kids to Raging Waters today.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: Oh.  I can't, honey.  I'm on a roll here.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: Baby, this thing is going to blow 'em all away. It's a neural-net process --

turns.speaker: TARISSA
turns.text: I know.  You told me.  It's a neural-net processor.  It thinks and learns like we do. It's superconducting at room temperature. Other computer are pocket calculators by comparison.  But why is that so goddamn important, Miles? I really need to know, 'cause I feel like I'm going crazy here, sometimes.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: I'm sorry, honey, it's just that I'm thiiis close.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: Imagine a jetline with a pilot that never makes a mistake, never gets tired, never shows up to work with a hangover.  Meet the pilot.

turns.speaker: TARISSA
turns.text: Why did you marry me, Miles?  Why did we have these two children?  You don't need us.  Your heart and your mind are in here.  But it doesn't love you like we do.

turns.speaker: TARISSA
turns.text: But I thought... aren't we changing things?  I mean... right now?  Changing the way it goes?

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: That's right!  There's no way I'm going to finish the new processor now.  Forget it.  I'm out of it.  I'm quitting Cyberdyne tomorrow... I'll sell real estate, I don't care,,,

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: Please... let... the kids... go...

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Shut up!  SHUT UP!!  Motherfucker!  It's all your fault!  IT'S YOUR FAULT!!

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: Do you know about the chip?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What chip?

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: They have it in a vault at Cyberdyne...  It's gotta be from the other one like you.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: They told us not to ask where they got it.  I thought... Japan... hell, I don't know.  I didn't want to know.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Those lying motherfuckers!

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: I was scary stuff, radically advanced.  It was shattered... didn't work.  But it gave us ideas, It took us in new directions... things we would never have thought of.  All this work is based on it.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: We should abort.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: NO!! We're going all the way!  You got that, Dyson?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Do you have bandages?

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: In the bathroom.  Danny, can you get them for us?

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: My God.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Now listen to me very carefully.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: Look, whatever you want me to do, I'll do.  I just want my kids to have a chance to grow up, okay?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: No one must follow your work.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: Alright, yeah.  You're right.  We have to destroy the stuff at the lab, the files, disk drive... and everything I have here.  Everything! I don't care.

turns.speaker: DYSON
turns.text: No good.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Let me try mine.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Now don't take this the wrong way, but you are a terminator, right?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Yes.  Cyberdyne Systems, Model 101.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No way!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Holy shit... you're really real!  I mean... whoah!  You're, uh... like a machine underneath, right... but sort of alive outside?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: I'm a cybernetic organism.  Living tissue over a metal endoskeleton.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: This in intense.  Get a grip, John.  Okay, uh... you're not here to kill me... I figured that part out for myself.  So what's the deal?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: My mission is to protect you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah?  Who sent you?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: You did.  Thirty years from now you reprogrammed me to be your protector here, in this time.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So this other guy?  He's a terminator too, right, like you?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Not like me.  A T-1000.  Advanced prototype. A mimetic polyalloy.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Liquid metal.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Radical.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: You are targeted for termination.  The T-1000 will not stop until it complete its mission. Ever.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Where we going?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: We have to leave the city, immediately.  And avoid the authorities.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Can I stop by my house?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Negative.  The T-1000 will definitely try to reacquire you there.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: I would.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: I'm right here.  I'm fine.  What's the dog's name?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Max.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I need a minute here, okay?  You're telling me it can imitate anything it touches?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Anything it samples by physical contact.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Like it could disguise itself as anything... a pack of cigarettes?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: No.  Only an object of equal size.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, why doesn't become a bomb or something to get me?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: It can't form complex machines.  Guns and explosives have chemicals, moving parts.  It doesn't work that way.  But it can form solid metal shapes.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We spent a lot of time in Nicaragua... places like that.  For a while she was with this crazy ex-Green Beret guy, running guns.  Then there were some other guys.  She'd shack up with anybody she could learn from.  So then she could teach me how to be this great military leader.  Then she gets busted and it's like... sorry kid, your mom's a psycho.  Didn't you know?  It's like... everything I'd been brought up to believe was just made-up fantasy, right? I hated her for that.  But everything she said was true.  We gotta get her out of there.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Negative.  The T-1000's highest probability for success now would be to copy Sarah Connor and wait for you to make contact with her.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh, great.  And what happens to her?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Typically, the subject being copied is terminated.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: TERMINATED!?  Shit!  Why didn't you tell me? We gotta right now!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Negative.  She is not a mission priority.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, well fuck you, she's a priority to me!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oww!  Why'd you do that?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: You told me to.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You have to do what I say?!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: That is one of my mission parameters.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Prove it... stand on one foot.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Jesus... you were gonna kill that guy!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Of course.  I'm a terminator.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Listen to me, very carefully, okay?  You're not a terminator any more.  Alright?  You got that? You can't just go around killing people!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Whattaya mean, why?  'Cause you can't!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You just can't, okay?  Trust me on this.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Now remember, you're not gonna kill anyone, right?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Swear.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Just say "I swear I won't kill anyone."

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Everything.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Does it hurt?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: I sense injuries.  The data could be called pain.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: How long do you live?  I mean, last?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: A hundred and twenty years on my existing power cell.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Affirmative.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No, no, no.  You gotta listen to the way people talk.  See, you don't say like "Affirmative" or some shit like that.  You say... no problemo.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It someone comes off to you with an attitude, you say "eat me"... if you wanna shine them on, it's "Hasta la vista, baby".

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: "Hasta la vista, baby"?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, or "later, dickwad."  Or if someone gets upset you say "chill out."  Like that.  Or you can do combinations.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Chill out, dickwad.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: That's great!  See, you're getting it.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: No problemo.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: And that's another thing.  You could lighten up a bit, yourself.  This severe routine is getting old.  Smile once in a while.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Smile?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah.  Smile.  You know.  People smile, right? Watch.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: We're not gonna make it, are we?  People, I mean.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: It is in your nature to destroy yourselves.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Excellent.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, I thought you'd like this place.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Not even of dying?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You don't feel any emotion about it one way or the other?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: No.  I have to stay functional until my mission is complete.  Then it doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Torque wrench please.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Here.  I wish I coulda met my real dad.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: You will.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah.  I guess so.  My mom says when I'm, like, 45, I think, I send him back through time to 1984.  But right now he hasn't even been born yet.  Man, is messes with your head.  Where's that other bolt?  Thanks.  Mom and him were only together for one night, but she still loves him, I guess.  I see her crying sometimes.  She denies it totally, of course.  Like she says she got something in her eye.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Why do you cry?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You mean people?  I don't know.  We just cry. You know.  When it hurts.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Pain causes it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Uh-unh, no, it's different... It's when there's nothing wrong with you but you hurt anyway.  You get it?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Alriight!!  My man!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: No problemo.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: "No fate."  No fate but what we make.  My father told her this... I mean I made him memorize it, up in the future, as a message to her -- Never mind.  Okay, the whole thing goes "The future is not set.  There is no fate but what we make for ourselves."

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: She intends to change the future somehow.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I guess, yeah --  Oh shit!!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Dyson.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, gotta be!  Miles Dyson!  She's gonna blow him away!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: This is tactically dangerous.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Drive faster.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: The T-1000 has the same files that I do.  It could anticipate this move and reacquire you at Dyson's house.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't care.  We've gotta stop her.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Killing Dyson might actually prevent the war.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't care!! There's gotta be another way. Haven't you learned anything?!  Haven't you figured out why you can't kill people?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: I'll deal with the police.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Remember what I said, you can't...

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Trust me.

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Drive for a minute.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Where you going?!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: We don't have much time.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Is it dead?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Terminated.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Will it melt in there?

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: Yes.  Throw it in.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: I'm sorry, John.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No, no no!!  It'll be okay.  Stay with us!

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: I have to go away, John.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Don't do it.  Please... don't go --

turns.speaker: TERMINATOR
turns.text: It must end here... or I am the future.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I order you not to!

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Your foster parents are kinda dicks, right?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Gimme that Phillips right there.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Easy money!

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: Where'd you learn all this stuff?

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: So she's pretty cool, huh?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Actually, no, she's a complete psycho.  That's why she's up at Pescedero.  She tries to blow up a computer factory, but she got shot and arrested.

turns.speaker: TIM
turns.text: No shit?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah, she's a total loser.  C'mon, let's check out the 7-Eleven, whatya say?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Out of the way, John!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No!  Don't kill him!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: It, John.  Not him.  It.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Alright, it!  We need it!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: We're better off by ourselves.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: But it's the only proof we have to the future... about the war and all that.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I don't trust it!  These things are hard to kill, John, believe me, I know.  We may never have this opportunity again.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Look, Mom, if I'm supposed to ever be this great leader, you should start listening to my leadership ideas once in a while.  'Cause if you won't, nobody else will.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah.  Drag, huh?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I need to know how Skynet get built.  Who's responsible?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Mom?  You okay?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I couldn't... oh, God.  You... came here... to stop me?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: It's okay.  It'll by okay.  We'll figure it out.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I love you, John.  I always have.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I know, Mom.  I know.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Yeah.  Right.  How were you supposed to know? Fucking men... all you know how to do is thrust into the world with your... fucking ideas and your weapons.  Did you know that every gun in the world is named after a man?  Colt, Browning, Smith, Thompson, Kalashnikov... all men.  Men built the hydrogen bomb, not women... men like you thought it up.  You're so creative.  You don't know what it's like to really create something... to create a life.  To feel it growing inside you.  All you know how to create is death... you fucking bastards.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Mom, Mom, we need to be more constructive here. I don't see this as a gender-related issue.  She's still tense.  We still have to figure out how to stop it all from happening.  Right?
